definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies

sentences.english: This wire is intended to verify protection against access to hazardous live parts of electrical toys.
sentences.chinese: 本金属丝用于检验电动玩具的带电部件是否被触及。

sentences.english: Our teacher of physics suggested that we(should)try to make some electronic toys ourselves .
sentences.chinese: 我们的物理老师建议我们自己应试着做一些电动玩具。

sentences.english: He was just the right size for my electric toy car.
sentences.chinese: 他还可以坐着我的电动玩具车兜风。

sentences.english: When he saw the video machine, he exclaimed with joy.
sentences.chinese: 看到电动玩具时，他高兴得叫了起来。

sentences.english: The boy has a toy car worked by electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩有一个电动玩具汽车。

sentences.english: This is a "Panda Trucker". It is an electric toy.
sentences.chinese: 这是“熊猫卡车司机”，是个电动玩具。

sentences.english: The boy's new electronic toy train was the envy of his friends.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩子的新电动玩具火车使他的朋友们都很羡慕。
